pButton.popInfo: Fall of Constantinople – Ottoman Turks rename the city Istanbul and begin Muslim invasion into the Balkans. The Hundred Years' War ends.
Gutenberg Bible printed in Mainz, Germany. Johann Gutenberg had perfected movable type over the previous five years. This revolution in printing makes books affordable and portable.
Isabella and Ferdinand completed the unification of Spain; Islam is pushed out of Granada concluding the <font face='c-Italic'>Reconquista</font>; Admiral Columbus sets sail on his first voyage.
Martin Luther posts his 95 Theses in Wittenberg triggering the Protestant Reformation against the Catholic Church.
Magellan sets sail; Cortez conquers the Aztec Empire; Charles V (House of Hapsburg), already King of Spain as <font face='c-Italic'>Carlos I</font>, is elected Holy Roman Emperor as Charles V.
Suleiman “the Magnificent” begins rule as tenth Ottoman Sultan and will expand the Turkish-Islamic Empire deeper into Europe.
Council of Trent is convened by Pope Paul III to correct shortcomings in Catholicism (over the next eighteen years).
England under Queen Elizabeth I defeats the Spanish Armada under Philip II.
King Henry IV (House of Bourbon) issues Edict of Nantes allowing religious freedom in France.
